derivation.yuyuan_name: Middle English (denoting a cylinder on to which spun thread is wound): shortening of Old French espole or from Middle Low German spōle, of West Germanic origin; related to Dutch spoel and German Spule. The verb dates from the early 17th cent

entry.tran: 线轴;(录音带、胶卷的)卷轴
entry.def: A spool is a round object onto which thread, tape, or film can be wound, especially before it is put into a machine.

means.word_mean: 1. a winder around which thread or tape or film or other flexible materials can be wound
1. transfer data intended for a peripheral device (usually a printer) into temporary storage
2. wind onto a spool or a reel
